content.question:
<math alttext="2 A g with a positive one charge aqueous plus Z n solid react to produce 2 A g solid plus Z n with positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Zn(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Ag</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Under standard conditions, the galvanic cell shown above has a cell potential of <math alttext="positive 1.56 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1.56</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> using the reaction given. The salt bridge contains <math alttext="K N O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>KNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, which allows <math alttext="K with a positive one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions and <math alttext="N O 3 with a negative one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions to move in the directions indicated. If <math alttext="K N O 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>KNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the salt bridge is replaced with <math alttext="K O H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, some <math alttext="Z n, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Zn(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> precipitates in the <math alttext="Zn, Zn, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mrow><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>-Zn(</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> half-cell. Which of the following best explains how the cell potential is affected as <math alttext="Z n, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Zn(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> starts to precipitate, and why?

choices.label: The cell potential increases because the concentration of <math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> decreases and <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="the fraction the molar concentration of Z n with a positive 2 charge over the molar concentration of A g with a positive one charge squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, becomes smaller.

The cell potential decreases because the concentration of <math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> decreases and <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="the fraction the molar concentration of Z n with a positive 2 charge over the molar concentration of A g with a positive one charge squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, becomes smaller.

The cell potential increases because <math alttext="K with a positive one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions replace <math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions and the reduction of <math alttext="K with a positive one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> is more thermodynamically favored than the reduction of <math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The cell potential stays the same because <math alttext="Z n, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 2, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Zn(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is not part of the redox reaction responsible for the operation of the galvanic cell.

content.answer: The cell potential increases because the concentration of <math alttext="Z n with a positive 2 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> decreases and <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="the fraction the molar concentration of Z n with a positive 2 charge over the molar concentration of A g with a positive one charge squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, becomes smaller.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
